title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 October 2015 - XWiki

13:14 <cjd> has quit  
13:40 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
14:00 <vmassol> mflorea: FYI I'm trying to understand why the parentschildrenlivetable macro is failing and whether it's normal or whether we've broken some backward compat stuff that we shouldn't have  
14:03 <vmassol> trying to understand the generated query now: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/48ac8b7a09fde35b86bc/raw/55f5ee80cde131c472bb321fb1a66cbf69a08c62/gistfile1.txt  
14:06 <vmassol> ah wait I know  
14:06 <vmassol> I think  
14:10 <vmassol> ok works fine :)  
14:11 <vmassol> no regression  
14:11 <vmassol> it's just that he executed his instance with the legacy oldcore!  
14:14 <tmortagne> without ?  
14:14 <tmortagne> because having legacy oldcore sounds pretty standard to me  
14:15 <vmassol> yes without  
14:15 <vmassol> maybe it's a different problem for him  
14:15 <vmassol> but I have reproduced the same error  
14:15 <vmassol> and for me the problem was that I didn't have the legacy oldcore  
14:15 <vmassol> when I added it the macro worked fine  
14:15 <vmassol> (on non-nested spaces ofc)  
14:20 <vmassol> mflorea: do you agree that this macro can be replaced with the documentTree macro now?  
14:21 <vmassol> (added a comment there: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Parent-Children+Livetable+macro )  
14:43 <mflorea> vmassol: a tree cannot fully replace a livetable  
14:43 <vmassol> ah yes forgot that aspect :)  
14:43 <vmassol> the children viewer should though  
14:43 <mflorea> yes  
14:43 <vmassol> it's only a velo macro right now I think  
14:43 <vmassol> need to check  
14:44 <vmassol> #displayChildren  
14:44 <vmassol> but no param  
14:45 <vmassol> so no good alternative for now  
14:45 <vmassol> we still need that xwiki/2.0+ macro for livetable…. {{livetable/}}  
14:45 <vmassol> fixing doc  
14:47 <Enygma`> ClemensR: Are you going to apply your suggestion https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/7cfbf62de2e1c2ed2c2b30ec561c18e08b3ebd62#commitcomment-13796960 to fix MOCCACAL-77 ?  
14:47 <ClemensR> I am not sure what this might break ...  
14:48 <Enygma`> I had a look and it seems to be a good solution  
14:48 <ClemensR> ... but if yiou aere not sure either, I am willing to take the blame and do the change ;)  
14:48 <ClemensR> if you are already at it ... well, I have no XWiki dev instance running atm  
14:49 <Enygma`> ok then, I`ll do it  
14:50 <ClemensR> ok, thanks!  
14:51 <Enygma`> I`ve also noticed another issue with the Mocca calendar app, that is when creating a calendar in a non-terminal page (something.WebHome) and then creating an event in this new calendar, the new event gets created in the space "something\.WebHome.eventName"  
14:51 <Enygma`> instead of something.WebHome.eventName  
14:51 <Enygma`> classic getSpace issue related to NestedSpaces  
14:51 <Enygma`> I`ll report it  
15:20 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:33 <Enygma`> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/MOCCACAL-82  
15:45 <ClemensR>  Enygma`: uh, oh, thanks for finding this  
15:58 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:01 <tmortagne> ClemensR: don't know if you saw the new extension I added, I tough about putting it in the main application but I did not wanted to add a PR constraint on it  
16:02 <ClemensR> I have seen it, just been pressed about other things  
16:02 <tmortagne> sure wanted to indicate why it's a separated extension  
16:02 <ClemensR> MoccaCal still requires PR anyway, due to the one or other mistake  
16:04 <ClemensR> there is still MOCCACAL-54  for example .... but anyway, in case that gets resolved, maybe it is better to have the iCal stuff in a separate module  
16:04 <ClemensR> I also see the current calendar listing livetable could need a hook for the iCal ... have not thought hard enough to find a solution for this, though  
16:06 <tmortagne> ClemensR: would be clear than what I did yes but it's working well for now  
16:06 <tmortagne> \*cleaner  
16:07 <ClemensR> as soon as I have an idea how to allow a hook there I will go for it ... first trying to understand/fix MOCCACAL-82 though  
16:19 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:27 <gsmeria> has quit  
17:12 <vmassol> indeed if there was a conflict you could have dropped it… since I'm pretty sure we won't release a 7.2.1  
17:12 <vmassol> sorry… (Enygma`)  
17:12 <vmassol> btw we should release 7.1.3  
17:12 <vmassol> let's see who's next on the roster  
17:13 <vmassol> ah it's thomas, lucky him  
17:23 <ClemensR> the "Scripting Documentation Application" is not working on my local 7.2-jetty-hsql instance. is this just me, or is this reproducible?  
17:25 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:27 <OSIMasson> has quit  
17:35 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Hi, the Distribution Wizard prompted me to upgrade XWiki to version 7.2. I clicked the "LATER" button. How can I start the wizard again? Thank you.  
17:40 <ClemensR> xwikiorg\_guest\_4:  did you try to restart the servlet container ?  
17:40 <msmeria> has quit  
17:41 <ClemensR> I think this \*should\* bring up the distribution wizard again  
17:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> I am not a system administrator on server. I am Wiki administrator. Can I restart the servlet from my workstation?  
17:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:42 <Ramona1> has quit  
17:42 <Ramona> has joined #xwiki  
17:45 <vmassol> xwikiorg\_guest\_4: depends on your servlet container and your permissions  
17:45 <vmassol> if you can access your container's admin console then yes  
17:47 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> I know nothing about the admin console. Sorry. :(  
17:48 <ClemensR> Ah, but you can check in the wiki admin -> extension manager -> extension updater  
17:48 <Ramona> has quit  
17:48 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Can I just install the extension "XWiki Enterprise Flavor - Main Wiki "? Can it harm the current wiki?  
17:48 <ClemensR> should allow to upgrade the UI there too, because tecnically the UI is just another extension  
17:48 <vmassol> mflorea or tmortagne may know some tricks  
17:49 <vmassol> ah yes indeed ClemensR is correct  
17:49 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Extension updater tells that all extensions are up to date.  
17:49 <ClemensR> main wiki UI is not soo good for subwikis, I am not sure if this breaks things  
17:49 <vmassol> it will  
17:49 <ClemensR> duh, then ... one moment ....  
17:51 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> The "XWiki Enterprise Flavor - Sub Wiki" is also available for install. Should I do that?  
17:51 <ClemensR> ... sounds better. hang on, I try to check something ...  
17:52 <mflorea> xwikiorg\_guest\_4: do you have anything listed in the "Installed Extensions" section?  
17:52 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Actually I have only one wiki. Does it simplify the situation?  
17:53 <ClemensR> you are administering a subwiki in a farm of wikis? or is this just the main wiki ?  
17:53 <ClemensR> if the "XWiki Enterprise Flavor - Sub Wiki" is already installed, then you have a subwiki to  manage  
17:53 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> @mflorea "There are no extensions installed."  
17:54 <mflorea> then it means that the extension index has been deleted somehow  
17:54 <mflorea> probably because the permanent directory has not been set correctly and it defaulted to a temp folder inside the servlet container  
17:55 <mflorea> and that temp folder has been deleted  
17:55 <mflorea> best is to find a way to restart the wiki and to use the Distribution Wizard to repair the UI (and thus extension index)  
17:55 <ClemensR> this is a job for the server admin, definitely. if the wiki itself is fine then there is nothing to do for the local wiki admin for the moment  
17:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> For the XWiki extensions (Main and Sub) the "Install" button is available. I believe they are not installed yet. Can I install them and it upgrades my Wiki?  
17:56 <mflorea> they are not marked as installed, but you have the wiki pages, otherwise you wouldn't have access to the administration  
17:57 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Yes, It looks they are not installed. Can I install them?  
17:57 <ClemensR> reinstalling them might ... just lead to odd conflicts. your server admin should try to recover the "permanent directory". unless that is fixed, you will have to deal with the situation again and again  
17:58 <ClemensR> it is just the marker in the "permanent dir" that has been lost; the actual pages are installed, no need to install them again  
17:58 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> OK. I am going to ask our system admin to restart the XWiki server. Is that the solution?  
17:58 <ClemensR> ask your system admin to read the documentation first ;) ... one moment  
17:59 <tmortagne> first thing to do is check what permanent dir has been configured and fix it because given the issue it probably not been configured at all  
18:00 <tmortagne> the best would be to found where the initial permanent dir went but it probably been deleted as a temp dir  
18:00 <tmortagne> once the perm dir is probably configured then you should do what mflorea and restart to get a repair UI that will register again the XE flavor  
18:00 <mflorea> yep  
18:01 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Fine. I believe I am charged with the solution. Thanks a lot!!!!  
18:02 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> Bye!  
18:02 <ClemensR> ok, bye :)  
18:02 <xwikiorg\_guest\_4> has left #xwiki
